isis.stitle: 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES FS-5106 AND FS-6206 - DISASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT AND REVERSE IDLER

step1.para: Position puller jaws behind the rear countershaft bearing and remove the bearing ( Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Position Puller Jaws and Remove Bearing

step1.para: Position countershaft in vise, front of shaft facing up. Position puller jaws into notches behind the front countershaft bearing and remove the bearing ( Figure 53).

figure.caption: Figure 53. Position Puller Jaws and Remove Bearing

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the front of the shaft ( Figure 54).

figure.caption: Figure 54. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use the rear face of the drive gear as a base, then press it from the countershaft as shown ( Figure 55). Remove the drive gear locating key from the shaft (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Press Drive Gear From Countershaft and Remove Drive Gear Locating Key

step1.para: Use the rear face of 5th speed gear as a base and press it from the countershaft ( Figure 56). Remove 5th gear key from the shaft (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 56. Press 5th Speed Gear From Countershaft and Remove 5th Gear Key

step1.para: Use the rear face of 4th speed gear as a base and press it from the countershaft ( Figure 57).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Press 4th Speed Gear From Countershaft

note.para: Be sure that 5th and 6th speed gear keys have been removed before removing 4th gear from countershaft.

step1.para: Use the rear face of 3rd speed gear as a base and press it from the countershaft ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 58. Press 3rd Speed Gear From Countershaft
